Created an attachment (id=80733)
screenshot

Description:
Error pops up when select value for a map or highlight rule.

Build number:
2.2.1.v20071019-0630

Steps to reproduce:
1. New a table binding to a data set.
2. Select one row and add a map/highlight rule and select "Select value...".

Expected result:
Value can be select.

Actual result:
Error pops up (see the attached screenshot) and no data can be retrieved.

Error log:
N/A

Exception is thrown out when add a map rule for the table group header row in build (2.3.0.v20071029-0800), reopen.

I can't reproduce this bug on more than 1 computers.
I suspect it's a building issue.

Set to FIXED.
Please reopen it if you can reproduce it with the build version of tomorrow.

Exception is thrown out when add a map rule for the table group header row in
build (2.3.0.v20071029-0800), reopen.

After updating code, I found it does throw an exception.
Please model team investigate this function
 MapRule.setProperty(property, text);
it may contain something error.
Reassign this bug to Model.

Highlight also has the same issue.
Exactly, please investigate this function Structure.setProperty(property, value).
StyleRule.setIntrinsicProperty() should avoid ClassCastException. Backward compatibility is necessary.
